title: Please Help Me, my lord (rads_user_kernel.exe problems)
body:
OKAY! Lets start from the top, shall we?

So, a couple moths ago, when the Beta Client got launched to players, I upgraded cause I'd seen a few videos on it and it looked amazing. So I upgraded it, play a couple games, then didn't play for a couple of days. When I started the updater, it told me that I had to switch back to leagacy Client.  I thought it was weird but whatever. Didn't know how, so I just uninstall.jpg'd and reinstalled. All went well until I tried upgrading again about a moth later, I pressed "Yes I would like to join the beta" or whatever it says from the updater, and it just sat there and did nothing. So I went, "Sweet it must have done it instantly! Coolio!"  **NOT** the case.. In fact, it told me to go ~~fuck~~ and reinstall the legacy client again. 

"Great" I said to myself, and for the next couple of months I tried every once and a while to install the beta client and it never worked, so I would uninstall.jpg and reinstall the game every few days. NOT THIS TIME.

No, this time when I went to do it whilst it was updating, NOT ONLY DID IT TELL ME TO UNINSTALL AND REINSTALL, WHEN I DID IT TOLD ME IT COULDN'T OVERWRITE rads_user_kernel.exe

Okay, I thought to myself as I went to the folder where LoL is on my computer, "all I have to do is drag this folder into the garbage bin, empty it, and reinstall again."  I went and attempted to throw the folder into the garbage, It got half way when it stopped and told me "You don't have permission to delete rads_user_kernel.exe" AND I KNOW ITS NOT MY COMPUTER CAUSE I HAVE FULL ACCESS TO EVERYTHING ON THERE. Some where along the line of uninstalling and reinstalling this last time, something has **LOCKED** rads_user_kernel.exe

I've done a solid couple hours of research and I have no idea what cased this or how to fix it.

Can someone please help me.

I'm on windows 10, and I have attempted to override my computer completely and access the file, but it keeps saying I dont have permission.


Thank you

replies.body:
I haven't seen the notification about having to return to the legacy client, but you're really showing signs of a security setting that's blocking the updated client from installing properly and running.  Do not manually delete folders and files unless specifically suggested, otherwise you're only going to cause more issues and require a [reinstall](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends).  

My suggestion would be to run the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to see if you can at least grant access to those files specifically.  Make sure to go over every step, and let me the results.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=iciwh5Vi,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-06T23:24:35.541+0000)
>
> I haven't seen the notification about having to return to the legacy client, but you're really showing signs of a security setting that's blocking the updated client from installing properly and running.  Do not manually delete folders and files unless specifically suggested, otherwise you're only going to cause more issues and require a [reinstall](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends).  
> 
> My suggestion would be to run the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to see if you can at least grant access to those files specifically.  Make sure to go over every step, and let me the results.


> CHECK YOUR HARD DRIVE FOR ERRORS


This portion of the "Permissions" link you sent me helped to the fullest extent. Thank you very much for your help. It seems as though I had messed around with my Hard Drive a little to much. Won't happen again. I have fully reinstalled LoL and will **_NOT_** Be attempting the new Beta/Alpha Client till it becomes forced.

Again thank you so very much for your help

Have a great evening.

{{champion:32}}
